projectDesc.p: "玉蝴蝶" is part of The Global Medieval Sourcebook, a digital compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. This larger project comprises computer-readable transcriptions and/or editions of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century, and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia; accompanied by new English translations; high-resolution digital images of manuscript/early print sources, where available; an apparatus that includes critical introductions, textual notes and annotations; and a flexible user interface with which to navigate these materials.

editorialDecl.p: Transcriptions and translations are encoded in XML conforming to TEI (P5) guidelines. The original-language text is contained within <lem> tags and translations within <rdg> tags.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg: To the Tune “Jade Butterfly”
By mistake, I entered a narrow alley in the Pingkang Ward.
In the deep recess of the painted eaves,
the pearl curtain slightly raised.
Among the plain and patterned silk,
I recognized a beauty who I used to know.
Her dark eyebrows relaxed,
like charmingly extending ridges.
Her drooping dark hair with a green sheen,
was richly infused with spring mist.
I remembered the former love ties:
over a white wall like this,
some girl had peaked at Song Yu for three years.
I stayed,
at the coral table.
Holding a rhinoceros horn brush,
folding the fragrant paper,
she asked for a new lyric.
Tempting me with a smile, she stood in front of me,
following with the new song.
Her pearly voice grew steady.
Recalling our old love,
her radiant face became even more enticing.
She begged me to stay.
Phoenix quilt and lovebird pillows,
how could I bear to turn down this heavenly chance.
